creator: jochen.stiepel@dresdner-bank.com
text:
I start JMeter (latest CVS; Jdk 1.4.1) an load the test plan:
Thread Group
    - Http Request: GET /index.html from an apache webserver; no Redirect; no  
KeepAlive
    - View Results in Table


first entry (response) in "View Results in Table" -> Sample - ms: 2500 (or 
something like 2xxx)
all the next entries or requests :   between 40 and 50 ms

All the time after that I get allways times between 40 and 50 ms also with new 
Test Plans and other webservers in that running JMeter.
So I thought the first entry is to high.

Yes, this is probably hotspot compile time + new object creation time and the
like.  Obviously, all samples are timed in the same way, but the first time
objects are created, connections setup, possibly code is just-in-time compiled,
etc.  

A good fix for this would be to allow a user to specify a "warm-up" period
during which data is not logged.  

A good workaround is to let the test run for long enough to discount the
abnormally high first sample.
creator: mstover1@apache.org
